title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700 - The Times of India
summary:
Stock market today: BSE Sensex tanks over 800 points; Nifty50 near 23,700

Date: Today
Source: Times of India

Indian equity benchmark indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 faced significant declines today, dipping below 78,500 and just above 23,700 respectively. Key factors include recent comments from the US Federal Reserve affecting investor confidence.

  • BSE Sensex declined by 836 points (1.06%) to 78,382.17.
  • Nifty50 dropped by 241 points (1.01%) to 23,710.95.
  • Foreign investors sold shares worth 122.31 billion rupees ($1.44 billion) this week.
  • Weekly declines of both indices exceed 3%, marking the first drop after four weeks of gains.
  • Top gainers included Asian Paints, Nestle India, and Titan Company, while major losers were Tech Mahindra and Axis Bank.
“Despite the weakness, oversold conditions and resilience in select pockets present buying opportunities.” - Ajit Mishra, SVP, Research, Religare Broking

In conclusion, the current pressure on the stock market can be attributed to global economic conditions, particularly the US Federal Reserve's recent statements on interest rates, prompting caution among investors.
newTitle: Stock Market Update: BSE Sensex Drops Over 800 Points, Nifty50 Nears 23,700

title: Siemens India shares see a sharp fall of up to 8% — Explained - CNBCTV18
summary:
Siemens India shares see a sharp fall of up to 8% — Explained

Publication Date: December 20, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of Siemens India Ltd. have seen a significant fall of up to 8% following comments made during a post-earnings call regarding the state of private capital expenditure.

  • Shares are currently down 13% from their recent peak.
  • Private capex has not shown meaningful improvement overall.
  • Strong demand noted in the energy business, particularly in the transmission segment due to renewables.
  • Company not participating in LCC tenders but remains active in the VSC segment.
  • Digital industries facing challenges due to semiconductor shortages and destocking.
  • Current trading price is ₹7,047, down from a peak of ₹8,129.
Management expects recovery in the digital industries business in the coming quarters.

The decline in Siemens India's shares reflects broader challenges in private capital expenditure and supply chain disruptions; however, growth in certain sectors offers a glimmer of hope.
newTitle: Siemens India Shares Experience Significant Decline - Analysis

title: Supreme Court Sets Aside NCDRC Judgment Barring Banks From Charging More Than 30% Interest On Credit Card ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Overturns NCDRC's 30% Interest Cap on Credit Cards

Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: Indian Kanoon

The Supreme Court has set aside a 2008 National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission (NCDRC) decision that established a 30% cap on interest rates charged by banks on credit cards, citing it as an excessive rate.

  • The NCDRC previously deemed interest rates over 30% as usurious following comparisons with international rates.
  • The Supreme Court's ruling allows banks more flexibility in setting interest rates above the previously established limit.
  • The case involves the HONGKONG AND SHANGHAI BANKING CORP. LTD. and other parties.
“Charging of interest in excess of 30 per cent shall be considered usuries rate of interest and that if such rate of interest is charged, it would amount to unfair trade practice.”

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's decision marks a significant change in the regulation of credit card interest rates in India, potentially leading to higher costs for consumers.
newTitle: Supreme Court Overturns NCDRC's 30% Interest Cap on Credit Cards

International Gemmological Institute IPO share listing today: Stock debuts at 22% premium over issue price - CNBCTV18
summary:
International Gemmological Institute IPO share listing today: Stock debuts at 22% premium over issue price

Date: December 20, 2024 Source: Various News Outlets

The shares of the International Gemmological Institute (India) debuted on the exchanges with a premium of 22%.

The IPO was well-received, showcasing strong interest from investors and analysts alike.

  • Shares listed at ₹510 on NSE, compared to an upper price band of ₹417.
  • On BSE, shares listed at ₹504.85, indicating a 21% premium.
  • The IPO received a subscription of 35 times, reflecting robust demand.
  • Funds will be used to acquire IGI Belgium and IGI Netherlands, consolidating global operations.
  • IGI India holds a 50% market share in the Indian certification market.
“As the jewellery market expands, the demand for certifications will likely grow, driving IGI’s business further,” said analyst Palak Devadiga.

The IPO's performance indicates strong investor confidence in IGI, positioning it well for future growth within the global jewellery market.
newTitle: International Gemmological Institute IPO share listing today: Stock debuts at 22% premium over issue price

‘Bhikhari ki aulad’: Rapido driver tells Mumbai techie over extra charge - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rapido Driver Abuses Mumbai Techie Over Extra Charge Dispute

Date: Dec 20, 2024 11:35 AM IST Source: Hindustan Times

A Mumbai-based techie, Ohshin Bhat, claims she was abused and threatened by a Rapido driver who tried to overcharge her, leading to a dispute that escalated into verbal insults.

  • The techie booked a 'Rapido Economy' ride but received a Premium vehicle, which typically costs more.
  • The driver demanded extra charges and threatened her when she refused to comply.
  • The driver insulted her, calling her a “Bhikhari ki aulad” (Child of a beggar).
  • Rapido has apologized and promised to investigate the driver's behavior after the incident gained attention on social media.
  • This incident is part of a pattern of concerning behavior among drivers for the ride-hailing service.
“Cancel kar do varna pel dunga khade khade (Cancel the ride or I will beat you up),” said the driver.

The incident underscores ongoing issues with ride-hailing services and driver conduct, prompting public calls for accountability.
newTitle: Rapido Driver Abuses Mumbai Techie Over Extra Charge Dispute

Ventive Hospitality, Carraro India, Senores Pharmaceuticals IPOs open today: Key details - Upstox
summary:
Ventive Hospitality, Carraro India, Senores Pharmaceuticals IPOs open for subscription: Key details

Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: Upstox

The initial public offerings (IPOs) for Senores Pharmaceuticals, Ventive Hospitality, and Carraro India opened for subscription on December 20, 2023.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO

The IPO is worth ₹582.11 crore, consisting of a fresh offering of ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of ₹82.11 crore. The price band ranges from ₹372 to ₹391 per share. Investors need to bid for a minimum of 38 shares, totaling ₹14,858.

Prior to the IPO, Senores Pharmaceuticals raised ₹260.63 crore from several anchor investors, including ICICI Prudential MF and SBI General Insurance.

Ventive Hospitality IPO

This IPO has a fresh issue value of ₹1,600 crore, aimed at clearing debt and general corporate purposes, with no offer for sale included. The price band is set at ₹610 to ₹643. A minimum bid consists of 23 shares, costing ₹14,789.

The company raised ₹719.55 crore from anchor investors, such as Government Pension Global Fund and SBI Life Insurance.

Carraro India IPO

Carraro India's IPO is set at ₹1,250 crore, featuring an exclusively offer for sale component, priced between ₹668 to ₹704 per share. The minimum bid is for 21 shares, costing ₹14,784.

It secured ₹375 crore from anchor investors, including Aditya Birla Sun Life MF and UTI MF.

Learn more about IPO listings and schedules on our page.
newTitle: Key Details on Ventive Hospitality, Carraro India, and Senores Pharmaceuticals IPOs Opening for Subscription

title: Infosys, TCS or Persistent Systems — These are the top Indian IT picks post Accenture results - CNBCTV18
summary:
Infosys, TCS or Persistent Systems — These are the top Indian IT picks post Accenture results

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

Accenture has reported its fiscal Q1 results, showing a strong performance which positively affects Indian IT stocks.

  • Accenture's BFSI vertical grew by 10% sequentially, indicating strong performance.
  • Brokerage Jefferies identifies Infosys, TCS, and Coforge as top picks in the IT sector.
  • Accenture's positive results led to a 7% increase in its share price, influencing firms like Infosys and Wipro.
  • Citi remains positive on Infosys while having a neutral rating on HCLTech.
  • Despite cautious optimism, Indian IT firms face challenges with weak order book growth.
  • JM Financial lists Infosys, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra as favored large-cap stocks.
“The upgrade to Accenture's guidance was due to faster execution of deals won earlier, which augurs well for Indian IT companies.”

The performance of Accenture is seen as a leading indicator for Indian IT services, suggesting potential opportunities despite existing challenges.
newTitle: Top Indian IT Stocks to Watch Post Accenture Results

Infosys, Wipro ADRs end with gains of up to 4% post Accenture results, can Indian IT replicate the move? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Infosys, Wipro ADRs end with gains of up to 4% post Accenture results, can Indian IT replicate the move?

Date: Dec 20, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

The US-listed shares (ADRs) of Infosys and Wipro recorded gains of up to 4% after Accenture reported better-than-expected quarterly results and raised its annual guidance.

  • Infosys ADR rose by 3.4%, while Wipro ADR climbed by 2.3%.
  • Accenture's revenue for the first quarter exceeded analyst expectations, leading to a 7% rise in its shares.
  • The company raised its full-year revenue guidance to 4-7% from 3-6%.
  • The BFSI segment of Accenture reported a robust 10% growth sequentially.
  • GenAI bookings reached $1.2 billion, indicating a 20% quarter-on-quarter growth.
  • Despite strong performance, management noted a lack of recovery in client spending, especially in smaller deals.
“The results of Accenture puts the entire Indian IT basket into focus.”

In conclusion, the performance of Accenture may signal potential opportunities for Indian IT firms if they can replicate similar growth trends.
newTitle: Infosys and Wipro Shares Rise Post Accenture's Strong Results

title: Merchant network at the core of Fino’s small finance bank bid | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Merchant network at the core of Fino’s small finance bank bid

Publication Date: December 2023, Source: Live Mint

Fino Payments Bank is seeking to convert into a small finance bank, planning to utilize its extensive merchant network for lending and loan collection services.

  • Fino has about 1.8 million merchants providing financial services.
  • The proposal was made to the regulator for approval in December 2023.
  • Managing Director Rishi Gupta emphasized the potential of merchants as loan collection points.
“A significant portion of these merchants can be used to collect loan repayments.” - Rishi Gupta

This proposal marks a strategic move by Fino Payments Bank to expand its customer base while leveraging existing resources effectively.
newTitle: Fino Payments Bank Leverages Merchant Network for Small Finance Bank Proposal
